Pre-Game Insights: Die Nationalelf's quarter-final exit to Spain has led to several established stars retiring from international duty, including World Cup winners from 2014.
Manuel Neuer will be succeeded by his deputy Marc-Andre ter Stegen in goal.
Ilkay Gundogan and Toni Kroos must be replaced in midfield.
New captain Joshua Kimmich is set to play at right-back, according to head coach Julian Nagelsmann.
Uncapped Angelo Stiller is one of five contenders to feature in a new-look engine room with Aleksandar Pavlovic, Robert Andrich, Pascal Gross, and Emre Can.

Real Madrid defender Antonio Rudiger has been rested, potentially allowing Nico Schlotterbeck and Jonathan Tah to partner in central defence, with Maximilian Mittelstadt joining Kimmich in the full-back roles.
Leroy Sane is still troubled by a groin injury and missed out on selection.
In the absence of Thomas Muller, Germany's creative burden will fall on Florian Wirtz and Jamal Musiala, who both impressed at the Euros.
Florian Wirtz and Jamal Musiala should start in support of Arsenal forward Kai Havertz up front, with Niclas Fullkrug of West Ham United likely to make a second-half cameo from the bench.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Germany won 5-0 against Hungary with goals from Fullkrug, Musiala, Wirtz, Pavlovic, and Havertz (penalty).
